intro: Chaerophyllum reflexum var. orientalis, commonly known as the Eastern hedge-parsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role as a food source for various insects and small mammals.
